ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Stack
ContainedObjects.Description: Discard to add +2 to ONE of your Skills (Agility, Lore, etc.) until the end of the turn.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Stack
ContainedObjects.Description:
Counts as 5 Poison Markers

At the start of a Hero's Activation roll a D6 for EACH Poison Marker they currently have on them:

-On the roll of 1 or 2, the Hero takes 1 Wound, ignoring Defense.

-On the roll of 6, discard that Marker as its Poison effect has worn off.

Remove all Poison Markers from a Hero at the end of an Adventure, or if they are KO'd.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Stack
ContainedObjects.Description:
At the start of a Hero's Activation roll a D6 for EACH Poison Marker they currently have on them:

-On the roll of 1 or 2, the Hero takes 1 Wound, ignoring Defense.

-On the roll of 6, discard that Marker as its Poison effect has worn off.

Remove all Poison Markers from a Hero at the end of an Adventure, or if they are KO'd.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Stack
ContainedObjects.Description: Discard to make all Enemies -2 Initiative until the end of the turn

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Stack
ContainedObjects.Description:
Discard to immediately gain D3 Fury Tokens.
Samurai Only

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Stack
ContainedObjects.Description:
If a Hero enclosed by Barriers has 3 or more Exertion markers at the start of their Activation (after gaining any for the current turn), they take D6 Wounds, ignoring Defense and Armor.

A Hero no longer in an area enclosed by Barriers may remove 1 Exertion marker from themselves at the start of each of their Activations.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Stack
ContainedObjects.Description:
This model is -1 Defense and cannot move.

At the start of this model's Activation, it may make a Strength 5+ test to remove this marker (or on the D6 roll of 5 or 6 if the model does not have a Strength value).

Limit 1 Ensnared marker at a time. Remove this marker at the end of a Fight or if KO'd.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Tile
ContainedObjects.Description:
At the end of each turn during a Fight, as long as there is at least one Hero or Enemy model on the same Map Tile as this Corpse Token, roll a D6.

On the roll of 1, remove it.

On the roll of 5 or 6, replace it with a Dishonored Dead. If you do not have a Dishonored Dead to place, instead remove this marker and move the Darkness 1 space forward on the Depth Track.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Tile
ContainedObjects.Description:

On the roll of 5 or 6, replace it with a Dishonored Dead. If you do not have a Dishonored Dead to place, instead remove this marker and move the Darkness 1 space forward on the Depth Track.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Stack
ContainedObjects.Description:
A model is -3 Health for EACH Bleeding Marker it currently has.

A Hero reduced to 0 Health is KO'd.
An Enemy reduced to 0 Health is killed.

The Hero may use 1 Grit at any time to remove ONE Bleeding Marker.

Remove all Bleeding Markers from a Hero at the end of an Adventure, or if they are KO'd.

Undead are immune to Bleeding Markers.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Token
ContainedObjects.LuaScript:
--[[    Shadows of Brimstone Character Sheet Template    by: MrStump

You can set up your own character sheet if you follow these steps.

Step 1) Change the character sheet image
    -Right click on the character sheet, click Custom
    -Replace the image URL with one for your character sheet
    -Click import, make sure your sheet loads
    -SAVE THE GAME (the table setup)
    -LOAD FROM THAT SAVE YOU JUST MADE

Step 2) Edit script to fit your character sheet
    -Below you will see some general options, and then the big data table
    -The data table is what determines how many of which buttons are made
        -Checkboxes
        -Counters
        -Textboxes
    -By default, there are 3 of each. You can add more or remove entries
    -If you intend to add/remove, be sure only to add/remove ENTRIES
        -This is what an entry looks like:
            {
                pos   = {-0.977,0.1,-0.589},
                size  = 800,
                state = false
            },
        -Deleting the whole thing would remove that specific item on the sheet
        -Copy and pasting it after another entry would create another
    -Each entry type has unique data points (pos, size, state, etc)
        -Do not try to add in your own data points or remove them individually
        -There is a summary of what each point does at the top of its category

Step 3) Save and check script changes
    -Hit Save & Apply in the script window to save your code
    -You can edit your code as needed and Save+Apply as often as needed
    -When you are finished, make disableSave = false below then Save+apply
        -This enables saving, so your sheet will remember whats on it.

Bonus) Finding/Editing Positions for elements
    I have included a tool to get positions for buttons in {x,y,z} form
    Place it where you want the center of your element to be
    Then copy the table from the notes (lower right of screen)
        You can highlight it and CTRL+C
    Paste it into the data table where needed (pos=)
    If you want to manually tweek the values:
        {0,0,0} is the center of the character sheet
        {1,0,0} is right, {-1,0,0} is left
        {0,0,-1} is up, {0,0,1} is down
        0.1 for Y is the height off of the page.
            If it was 0, it would be down inside the model of the sheet

Begin editing below:    ]]

--Set this to true while editing and false when you have finished
disableSave = false
--Remember to st this to false once you are done making changes
--Then, after you save & apply it, save your game too

--Color information for button text (r,g,b, values of 0-1)
buttonFontColor = {0,0,0}
--Color information for button background
buttonColor = {1,1,0.65}
--Change scale of button (Avoid changing if possible)
buttonScale = {0.1,0.1,0.1}

--This is the button placement information
defaultButtonData = {
    --Add checkboxes
    checkbox = {
        --[[
        pos   = the position (pasted from the helper tool)
        size  = height/width/font_size for checkbox
        state = default starting value for checkbox (true=checked, false=not)
        ]]
        --First checkbox
 --       {
 --           pos   = {-0.977,0.1,-0.589},
 --          size  = 800,
 --           state = false
 --       },
        --Second checkbox
  --      {
  --          pos   = {-0.163,0.1,-0.594},
  --          size  = 800,
  --          state = false
  --      },
        --Third checkbox
  --      {
  --          pos   = {0.735,0.1,-0.592},
  --          size  = 800,
  --          state = false
  --      },
        --End of checkboxes
    },
    --Add counters that have a + and - button
    counter = {
        --[[
        pos    = the position (pasted from the helper tool)
        size   = height/width/font_size for counter
        value  = default starting value for counter
        hideBG = if background of counter is hidden (true=hidden, false=not)
        ]]
        --Agility
        {
            pos    = {-0.1,0.05,-1.165},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 3,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Cunning
        {
            pos    = {0.425,0.05,-1.165},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 4,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Spirit
        {
            pos    = {0.9575,0.05,-1.165},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 2,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Strength
        {
            pos    = {0.16,0.05,-0.745},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 2,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Lore
        {
            pos    = {0.685,0.05,-0.745},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 1,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Luck
        {
            pos    = {1.215,0.05,-0.745},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 3,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Initiative
        {
            pos    = {1.83,0.05,-0.66},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 4,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Health
        {
            pos    = {0.012,0.05,1.1595},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 10,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Sanity
        {
            pos    = {1.15,0.05,1.1595},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 10,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --End of counters
    },
    --Add editable text boxes
    textbox = {
        --[[
        pos       = the position (pasted from the helper tool)
        rows      = how many lines of text you want for this box
        width     = how wide the text box is
        font_size = size of text. This and "rows" effect overall height
        label     = what is shown when there is no text. "" = nothing
        value     = text entered into box. "" = nothing
        alignment = Number to indicate how you want text aligned
                    (1=Automatic, 2=Left, 3=Center, 4=Right, 5=Justified)
        ]]
        --Range
          {
              pos       = {-1.285,0.05,1.19},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 1400,
              font_size = 1250,
              label     = "4+",
              value     = "4+",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Melee
          {
              pos       = {-0.805,0.05,1.19},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 1400,
              font_size = 1250,
              label     = "4+",
              value     = "4+",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Defense
          {
              pos       = {0.52,0.05,1.05},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 1400,
              font_size = 1250,
              label     = "3+",
              value     = "3+",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Willpower
          {
              pos       = {1.655,0.05,1.05},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 1400,
              font_size = 1250,
              label     = "4+",
              value     = "4+",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Combat
          {
              pos       = {-1.65,0.05,1.175},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 500,
              font_size = 600,
              label     = "2",
              value     = "2",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Max Grit
          {
              pos       = {-1.6,0.05,1.315},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 500,
              font_size = 600,
              label     = "2",
              value     = "2",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Class
   --       {
   --           pos       = {-1.278,0.05,-1.200},
   --          rows      = 1,
   --          width     = 5000,
   --           font_size = 800,
   --           label     = "Orphan",
   --           value     = "Orphan",
   --           alignment = 3
   --      },
       --KeyWords
          {
              pos       = {-1.325,0.05,0.65},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 5000,
              font_size = 400,
              label     = "Law - Traveler",
              value     = "Law - Traveler",
              alignment = 3
         },
        --End of textboxes
    }
}



--Lua beyond this point, I recommend doing something more fun with your life



--Save function
function updateSave()
    saved_data = JSON.encode(ref_buttonData)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    self.script_state = saved_data
end

--Startup procedure
function onload(saved_data)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    if saved_data ~= "" then
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        ref_buttonData = loaded_data
    else
        ref_buttonData = defaultButtonData
    end

    spawnedButtonCount = 0
    createCheckbox()
    createCounter()
    createTextbox()
end



--Click functions for buttons



--Checks or unchecks the given box
function click_checkbox(tableIndex, buttonIndex)
    if ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state == true then
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = false
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=""})
    else
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = true
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=string.char(10008)})
    end
    updateSave()
end

--Applies value to given counter display
function click_counter(tableIndex, buttonIndex, amount)
    ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value = ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value + amount
    self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value})
    updateSave()
end

--Updates saved value for given text box
function click_textbox(i, value, selected)
    if selected == false then
        ref_buttonData.textbox[i].value = value
        updateSave()
    end
end

--Dud function for if you have a background on a counter
function click_none() end



--Button creation



--Makes checkboxes
function createCheckbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.checkbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local buttonNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        local funcName = "checkbox"..i
        local func = function() click_checkbox(i, buttonNumber) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = ""
        if data.state==true then label=string.char(10008) end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=data.size, width=data.size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

--Makes counters
function createCounter()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.counter) do
        --Sets up display
        local displayNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        --Sets up label
        local label = data.value
        --Sets height/width for display
        local size = data.size
        if data.hideBG == true then size = 0 end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function="click_none", function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up add 1
        local funcName = "counterAdd"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, 1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "+"
        --Sets up position
        local offsetDistance = (data.size/2 + data.size/4) * (buttonScale[1] * 0.002)
        local pos = {data.pos[1] + offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Sets up size
        local size = data.size / 2
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up subtract 1
        local funcName = "counterSub"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, -1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "-"
        --Set up position
        local pos = {data.pos[1] - offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

function createTextbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.textbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local funcName = "textbox"..i
        local func = function(_,_,val,sel) click_textbox(i,val,sel) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)

        self.createInput({
            input_function = funcName,
            function_owner = self,
            label          = data.label,
            alignment      = data.alignment,
            position       = data.pos,
            scale          = buttonScale,
            width          = data.width,
            height         = (data.font_size*data.rows)+24,
            font_size      = data.font_size,
            color          = buttonColor,
            font_color     = buttonFontColor,
            value          = data.value,
        })
    end
end

2.LuaScript:
--[[    Shadows of Brimstone Character Sheet Template    by: MrStump

You can set up your own character sheet if you follow these steps.

Step 1) Change the character sheet image
    -Right click on the character sheet, click Custom
    -Replace the image URL with one for your character sheet
    -Click import, make sure your sheet loads
    -SAVE THE GAME (the table setup)
    -LOAD FROM THAT SAVE YOU JUST MADE

Step 2) Edit script to fit your character sheet
    -Below you will see some general options, and then the big data table
    -The data table is what determines how many of which buttons are made
        -Checkboxes
        -Counters
        -Textboxes
    -By default, there are 3 of each. You can add more or remove entries
    -If you intend to add/remove, be sure only to add/remove ENTRIES
        -This is what an entry looks like:
            {
                pos   = {-0.977,0.1,-0.589},
                size  = 800,
                state = false
            },
        -Deleting the whole thing would remove that specific item on the sheet
        -Copy and pasting it after another entry would create another
    -Each entry type has unique data points (pos, size, state, etc)
        -Do not try to add in your own data points or remove them individually
        -There is a summary of what each point does at the top of its category

Step 3) Save and check script changes
    -Hit Save & Apply in the script window to save your code
    -You can edit your code as needed and Save+Apply as often as needed
    -When you are finished, make disableSave = false below then Save+apply
        -This enables saving, so your sheet will remember whats on it.

Bonus) Finding/Editing Positions for elements
    I have included a tool to get positions for buttons in {x,y,z} form
    Place it where you want the center of your element to be
    Then copy the table from the notes (lower right of screen)
        You can highlight it and CTRL+C
    Paste it into the data table where needed (pos=)
    If you want to manually tweek the values:
        {0,0,0} is the center of the character sheet
        {1,0,0} is right, {-1,0,0} is left
        {0,0,-1} is up, {0,0,1} is down
        0.1 for Y is the height off of the page.
            If it was 0, it would be down inside the model of the sheet

Begin editing below:    ]]

--Set this to true while editing and false when you have finished
disableSave = false
--Remember to st this to false once you are done making changes
--Then, after you save & apply it, save your game too

--Color information for button text (r,g,b, values of 0-1)
buttonFontColor = {0,0,0}
--Color information for button background
buttonColor = {1,1,0.65}
--Change scale of button (Avoid changing if possible)
buttonScale = {0.1,0.1,0.1}

--This is the button placement information
defaultButtonData = {
    --Add checkboxes
    checkbox = {
        --[[
        pos   = the position (pasted from the helper tool)
        size  = height/width/font_size for checkbox
        state = default starting value for checkbox (true=checked, false=not)
        ]]
        --First checkbox
 --       {
 --           pos   = {-0.977,0.1,-0.589},
 --          size  = 800,
 --           state = false
 --       },
        --Second checkbox
  --      {
  --          pos   = {-0.163,0.1,-0.594},
  --          size  = 800,
  --          state = false
  --      },
        --Third checkbox
  --      {
  --          pos   = {0.735,0.1,-0.592},
  --          size  = 800,
  --          state = false
  --      },
        --End of checkboxes
    },
    --Add counters that have a + and - button
    counter = {
        --[[
        pos    = the position (pasted from the helper tool)
        size   = height/width/font_size for counter
        value  = default starting value for counter
        hideBG = if background of counter is hidden (true=hidden, false=not)
        ]]
        --Agility
        {
            pos    = {-0.1,0.05,-1.165},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 3,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Cunning
        {
            pos    = {0.425,0.05,-1.165},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 4,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Spirit
        {
            pos    = {0.9575,0.05,-1.165},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 2,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Strength
        {
            pos    = {0.16,0.05,-0.745},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 2,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Lore
        {
            pos    = {0.685,0.05,-0.745},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 1,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Luck
        {
            pos    = {1.215,0.05,-0.745},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 3,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Initiative
        {
            pos    = {1.83,0.05,-0.66},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 4,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Health
        {
            pos    = {0.012,0.05,1.1595},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 10,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --Sanity
        {
            pos    = {1.15,0.05,1.1595},
            size   = 1200,
            value  = 10,
            hideBG = false
        },
        --End of counters
    },
    --Add editable text boxes
    textbox = {
        --[[
        pos       = the position (pasted from the helper tool)
        rows      = how many lines of text you want for this box
        width     = how wide the text box is
        font_size = size of text. This and "rows" effect overall height
        label     = what is shown when there is no text. "" = nothing
        value     = text entered into box. "" = nothing
        alignment = Number to indicate how you want text aligned
                    (1=Automatic, 2=Left, 3=Center, 4=Right, 5=Justified)
        ]]
        --Range
          {
              pos       = {-1.285,0.05,1.19},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 1400,
              font_size = 1250,
              label     = "4+",
              value     = "4+",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Melee
          {
              pos       = {-0.805,0.05,1.19},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 1400,
              font_size = 1250,
              label     = "4+",
              value     = "4+",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Defense
          {
              pos       = {0.52,0.05,1.05},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 1400,
              font_size = 1250,
              label     = "3+",
              value     = "3+",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Willpower
          {
              pos       = {1.655,0.05,1.05},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 1400,
              font_size = 1250,
              label     = "4+",
              value     = "4+",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Combat
          {
              pos       = {-1.65,0.05,1.175},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 500,
              font_size = 600,
              label     = "2",
              value     = "2",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Max Grit
          {
              pos       = {-1.6,0.05,1.315},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 500,
              font_size = 600,
              label     = "2",
              value     = "2",
              alignment = 3
         },
       --Class
   --       {
   --           pos       = {-1.278,0.05,-1.200},
   --          rows      = 1,
   --          width     = 5000,
   --           font_size = 800,
   --           label     = "Orphan",
   --           value     = "Orphan",
   --           alignment = 3
   --      },
       --KeyWords
          {
              pos       = {-1.325,0.05,0.65},
             rows      = 1,
             width     = 5000,
              font_size = 400,
              label     = "Law - Traveler",
              value     = "Law - Traveler",
              alignment = 3
         },
        --End of textboxes
    }
}



--Lua beyond this point, I recommend doing something more fun with your life



--Save function
function updateSave()
    saved_data = JSON.encode(ref_buttonData)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    self.script_state = saved_data
end

--Startup procedure
function onload(saved_data)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    if saved_data ~= "" then
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        ref_buttonData = loaded_data
    else
        ref_buttonData = defaultButtonData
    end

    spawnedButtonCount = 0
    createCheckbox()
    createCounter()
    createTextbox()
end



--Click functions for buttons



--Checks or unchecks the given box
function click_checkbox(tableIndex, buttonIndex)
    if ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state == true then
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = false
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=""})
    else
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = true
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=string.char(10008)})
    end
    updateSave()
end

--Applies value to given counter display
function click_counter(tableIndex, buttonIndex, amount)
    ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value = ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value + amount
    self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value})
    updateSave()
end

--Updates saved value for given text box
function click_textbox(i, value, selected)
    if selected == false then
        ref_buttonData.textbox[i].value = value
        updateSave()
    end
end

--Dud function for if you have a background on a counter
function click_none() end



--Button creation



--Makes checkboxes
function createCheckbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.checkbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local buttonNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        local funcName = "checkbox"..i
        local func = function() click_checkbox(i, buttonNumber) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = ""
        if data.state==true then label=string.char(10008) end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=data.size, width=data.size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

--Makes counters
function createCounter()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.counter) do
        --Sets up display
        local displayNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        --Sets up label
        local label = data.value
        --Sets height/width for display
        local size = data.size
        if data.hideBG == true then size = 0 end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function="click_none", function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up add 1
        local funcName = "counterAdd"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, 1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "+"
        --Sets up position
        local offsetDistance = (data.size/2 + data.size/4) * (buttonScale[1] * 0.002)
        local pos = {data.pos[1] + offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Sets up size
        local size = data.size / 2
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up subtract 1
        local funcName = "counterSub"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, -1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "-"
        --Set up position
        local pos = {data.pos[1] - offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

function createTextbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.textbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local funcName = "textbox"..i
        local func = function(_,_,val,sel) click_textbox(i,val,sel) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)

        self.createInput({
            input_function = funcName,
            function_owner = self,
            label          = data.label,
            alignment      = data.alignment,
            position       = data.pos,
            scale          = buttonScale,
            width          = data.width,
            height         = (data.font_size*data.rows)+24,
            font_size      = data.font_size,
            color          = buttonColor,
            font_color     = buttonFontColor,
            value          = data.value,
        })
    end
end

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: Until the end of the turn, all non-Myth Enemies on your Map Tile are -2 Move and -1 on all of their To Hit rolls.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description:
Until the end of the turn, every Hit you take does 1 less Wound than normal.

At Level 3 - Now 1 less Sanity Damage on Horror Hits as well.
At Level 7 - You may now spend double the Mana Cost to cast this Spell to also grant you +1 on your Defense rolls until end of turn.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description:
You are +1 Move and may move through other models.
In addition, Enemies that do not have the ability to move through other models are -1 on their To Hit rolls against you, and you automatically pass Escape tests from them.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description:
This Hero counts as having Cover 4+ against all Attacks until the end of the turn.

This Spell effect is immediately canceled if this Hero makes an Attack.

Limit 1 Shield at a time.

At Level 3 - Now also removes any Burning markers this Hero has.
At Level 5 - This Hero now also automatically passes all Escape tests.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: Until the end of the turn, you are -1 on all of your To Hit rolls.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Infinite_Bag
ContainedObjects.Description: Until the end of its next Activation, this model is +2 Combat, but -1 on To Hit rolls. If this is an Enemy model, it is also -1 Defense.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model_Infinite_Bag

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: When this model is killed, it explodes just as though a Bomb had gone off in its space. (If the model is XL or bigger, every model adjacent to the Enemy's base is affected).

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description:
This model may not move during its next Activation and immediately takes 2 Hits.

At the start of each of its further Activations, it must roll a D6. On the roll of 5+, it breaks free (discarding this effect). Otherwise it takes 2 Hits and may not move this turn.

Models that are Large Size break free on 4+, XL on 3+, and larger automatically break free.

Limit 1 in play at a time.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model

This Hero counts as having Cover 5+ against all Attacks until the end of the turn.

This Spell effect is immediately canceled if this Hero moves.

Limit 1 Shield at a time.

At Level 3 - Now Cover 4+
At Level 5 - When Cast, all Enemies adjacent to this Hero also take 1 Hit.

             width     = 5000,

              label     = "Performer",
              value     = "Performer",
              alignment = 3
         },
        --End of textboxes
    }

--Save function
function updateSave()
    saved_data = JSON.encode(ref_buttonData)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    self.script_state = saved_data
end

--Startup procedure
function onload(saved_data)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    if saved_data ~= "" then
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        ref_buttonData = loaded_data
    else
        ref_buttonData = defaultButtonData
    end

    spawnedButtonCount = 0
    createCheckbox()
    createCounter()
    createTextbox()
end



--Click functions for buttons



--Checks or unchecks the given box
function click_checkbox(tableIndex, buttonIndex)
    if ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state == true then
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = false
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=""})
    else
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = true
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=string.char(10008)})
    end
    updateSave()
end

--Applies value to given counter display
function click_counter(tableIndex, buttonIndex, amount)
    ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value = ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value + amount
    self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value})
    updateSave()
end

--Updates saved value for given text box
function click_textbox(i, value, selected)
    if selected == false then
        ref_buttonData.textbox[i].value = value
        updateSave()
    end
end

--Dud function for if you have a background on a counter
function click_none() end



--Button creation



--Makes checkboxes
function createCheckbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.checkbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local buttonNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        local funcName = "checkbox"..i
        local func = function() click_checkbox(i, buttonNumber) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = ""
        if data.state==true then label=string.char(10008) end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=data.size, width=data.size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

--Makes counters
function createCounter()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.counter) do
        --Sets up display
        local displayNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        --Sets up label
        local label = data.value
        --Sets height/width for display
        local size = data.size
        if data.hideBG == true then size = 0 end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function="click_none", function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up add 1
        local funcName = "counterAdd"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, 1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "+"
        --Sets up position
        local offsetDistance = (data.size/2 + data.size/4) * (buttonScale[1] * 0.002)
        local pos = {data.pos[1] + offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Sets up size
        local size = data.size / 2
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up subtract 1
        local funcName = "counterSub"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, -1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "-"
        --Set up position
        local pos = {data.pos[1] - offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

function createTextbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.textbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local funcName = "textbox"..i
        local func = function(_,_,val,sel) click_textbox(i,val,sel) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)

        self.createInput({
            input_function = funcName,
            function_owner = self,
            label          = data.label,
            alignment      = data.alignment,
            position       = data.pos,
            scale          = buttonScale,
            width          = data.width,
            height         = (data.font_size*data.rows)+24,
            font_size      = data.font_size,
            color          = buttonColor,
            font_color     = buttonFontColor,
            value          = data.value,
        })
    end
end

                size  = 800,
                state = false

        -Copy and pasting it after another entry would create another

        -There is a summary of what each point does at the top of its category

    -Hit Save & Apply in the script window to save your code

        {1,0,0} is right, {-1,0,0} is left
        {0,0,-1} is up, {0,0,1} is down
        0.1 for Y is the height off of the page.

--Save function
function updateSave()
    saved_data = JSON.encode(ref_buttonData)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    self.script_state = saved_data
end

--Startup procedure
function onload(saved_data)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    if saved_data ~= "" then
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        ref_buttonData = loaded_data
    else
        ref_buttonData = defaultButtonData
    end

    spawnedButtonCount = 0
    createCheckbox()
    createCounter()
    createTextbox()
end



--Click functions for buttons



--Checks or unchecks the given box
function click_checkbox(tableIndex, buttonIndex)
    if ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state == true then
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = false
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=""})
    else
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = true
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=string.char(10008)})
    end
    updateSave()
end

--Applies value to given counter display
function click_counter(tableIndex, buttonIndex, amount)
    ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value = ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value + amount
    self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value})
    updateSave()
end

--Updates saved value for given text box
function click_textbox(i, value, selected)
    if selected == false then
        ref_buttonData.textbox[i].value = value
        updateSave()
    end
end

--Dud function for if you have a background on a counter
function click_none() end



--Button creation



--Makes checkboxes
function createCheckbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.checkbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local buttonNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        local funcName = "checkbox"..i
        local func = function() click_checkbox(i, buttonNumber) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = ""
        if data.state==true then label=string.char(10008) end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=data.size, width=data.size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

--Makes counters
function createCounter()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.counter) do
        --Sets up display
        local displayNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        --Sets up label
        local label = data.value
        --Sets height/width for display
        local size = data.size
        if data.hideBG == true then size = 0 end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function="click_none", function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up add 1
        local funcName = "counterAdd"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, 1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "+"
        --Sets up position
        local offsetDistance = (data.size/2 + data.size/4) * (buttonScale[1] * 0.002)
        local pos = {data.pos[1] + offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Sets up size
        local size = data.size / 2
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up subtract 1
        local funcName = "counterSub"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, -1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "-"
        --Set up position
        local pos = {data.pos[1] - offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

function createTextbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.textbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local funcName = "textbox"..i
        local func = function(_,_,val,sel) click_textbox(i,val,sel) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)

        self.createInput({
            input_function = funcName,
            function_owner = self,
            label          = data.label,
            alignment      = data.alignment,
            position       = data.pos,
            scale          = buttonScale,
            width          = data.width,
            height         = (data.font_size*data.rows)+24,
            font_size      = data.font_size,
            color          = buttonColor,
            font_color     = buttonFontColor,
            value          = data.value,
        })
    end
end

--[[    Shadows of Brimstone Character Sheet Template    by: MrStump

You can set up your own character sheet if you follow these steps.

Step 1) Change the character sheet image
    -Right click on the character sheet, click Custom
    -Replace the image URL with one for your character sheet
    -Click import, make sure your sheet loads
    -SAVE THE GAME (the table setup)
    -LOAD FROM THAT SAVE YOU JUST MADE

Step 2) Edit script to fit your character sheet
    -Below you will see some general options, and then the big data table
    -The data table is what determines how many of which buttons are made
        -Checkboxes
        -Counters
        -Textboxes
    -By default, there are 3 of each. You can add more or remove entries
    -If you intend to add/remove, be sure only to add/remove ENTRIES
        -This is what an entry looks like:
            {
                pos   = {-0.977,0.1,-0.589},
                size  = 800,
                state = false
            },
        -Deleting the whole thing would remove that specific item on the sheet
        -Copy and pasting it after another entry would create another
    -Each entry type has unique data points (pos, size, state, etc)
        -Do not try to add in your own data points or remove them individually
        -There is a summary of what each point does at the top of its category

Step 3) Save and check script changes
    -Hit Save & Apply in the script window to save your code
    -You can edit your code as needed and Save+Apply as often as needed
    -When you are finished, make disableSave = false below then Save+apply
        -This enables saving, so your sheet will remember whats on it.

Bonus) Finding/Editing Positions for elements
    I have included a tool to get positions for buttons in {x,y,z} form
    Place it where you want the center of your element to be
    Then copy the table from the notes (lower right of screen)
        You can highlight it and CTRL+C
    Paste it into the data table where needed (pos=)
    If you want to manually tweek the values:
        {0,0,0} is the center of the character sheet
        {1,0,0} is right, {-1,0,0} is left
        {0,0,-1} is up, {0,0,1} is down
        0.1 for Y is the height off of the page.
            If it was 0, it would be down inside the model of the sheet

Begin editing below:    ]]

        ]]

--Save function
function updateSave()
    saved_data = JSON.encode(ref_buttonData)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    self.script_state = saved_data
end

--Startup procedure
function onload(saved_data)
    if disableSave==true then saved_data="" end
    if saved_data ~= "" then
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        ref_buttonData = loaded_data
    else
        ref_buttonData = defaultButtonData
    end

    spawnedButtonCount = 0
    createCheckbox()
    createCounter()
    createTextbox()
end



--Click functions for buttons



--Checks or unchecks the given box
function click_checkbox(tableIndex, buttonIndex)
    if ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state == true then
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = false
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=""})
    else
        ref_buttonData.checkbox[tableIndex].state = true
        self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=string.char(10008)})
    end
    updateSave()
end

--Applies value to given counter display
function click_counter(tableIndex, buttonIndex, amount)
    ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value = ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value + amount
    self.editButton({index=buttonIndex, label=ref_buttonData.counter[tableIndex].value})
    updateSave()
end

--Updates saved value for given text box
function click_textbox(i, value, selected)
    if selected == false then
        ref_buttonData.textbox[i].value = value
        updateSave()
    end
end

--Dud function for if you have a background on a counter
function click_none() end



--Button creation



--Makes checkboxes
function createCheckbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.checkbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local buttonNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        local funcName = "checkbox"..i
        local func = function() click_checkbox(i, buttonNumber) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = ""
        if data.state==true then label=string.char(10008) end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=data.size, width=data.size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

--Makes counters
function createCounter()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.counter) do
        --Sets up display
        local displayNumber = spawnedButtonCount
        --Sets up label
        local label = data.value
        --Sets height/width for display
        local size = data.size
        if data.hideBG == true then size = 0 end
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function="click_none", function_owner=self,
            position=data.pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=data.size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up add 1
        local funcName = "counterAdd"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, 1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "+"
        --Sets up position
        local offsetDistance = (data.size/2 + data.size/4) * (buttonScale[1] * 0.002)
        local pos = {data.pos[1] + offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Sets up size
        local size = data.size / 2
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1

        --Sets up subtract 1
        local funcName = "counterSub"..i
        local func = function() click_counter(i, displayNumber, -1) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        --Sets up label
        local label = "-"
        --Set up position
        local pos = {data.pos[1] - offsetDistance, data.pos[2], data.pos[3]}
        --Creates button and counts it
        self.createButton({
            label=label, click_function=funcName, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=size, width=size,
            font_size=size, scale=buttonScale,
            color=buttonColor, font_color=buttonFontColor
        })
        spawnedButtonCount = spawnedButtonCount + 1
    end
end

function createTextbox()
    for i, data in ipairs(ref_buttonData.textbox) do
        --Sets up reference function
        local funcName = "textbox"..i
        local func = function(_,_,val,sel) click_textbox(i,val,sel) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)

        self.createInput({
            input_function = funcName,
            function_owner = self,
            label          = data.label,
            alignment      = data.alignment,
            position       = data.pos,
            scale          = buttonScale,
            width          = data.width,
            height         = (data.font_size*data.rows)+24,
            font_size      = data.font_size,
            color          = buttonColor,
            font_color     = buttonFontColor,
            value          = data.value,
        })
    end
end

--[[    Shadows of Brimstone Character Sheet Template    by: MrStump

You can set up your own character sheet if you follow these steps.

Step 1) Change the character sheet image
    -Right click on the character sheet, click Custom
    -Replace the image URL with one for your character sheet
    -Click import, make sure your sheet loads
    -SAVE THE GAME (the table setup)
    -LOAD FROM THAT SAVE YOU JUST MADE

Step 2) Edit script to fit your character sheet
    -Below you will see some general options, and then the big data table
    -The data table is what determines how many of which buttons are made
        -Checkboxes
        -Counters
        -Textboxes
    -By default, there are 3 of each. You can add more or remove entries
    -If you intend to add/remove, be sure only to add/remove ENTRIES
        -This is what an entry looks like:
            {
                pos   = {-0.977,0.1,-0.589},
                size  = 800,
                state = false
            },
        -Deleting the whole thing would remove that specific item on the sheet
        -Copy and pasting it after another entry would create another
    -Each entry type has unique data points (pos, size, state, etc)
        -Do not try to add in your own data points or remove them individually
        -There is a summary of what each point does at the top of its category

Step 3) Save and check script changes
    -Hit Save & Apply in the script window to save your code
    -You can edit your code as needed and Save+Apply as often as needed
    -When you are finished, make disableSave = false below then Save+apply
        -This enables saving, so your sheet will remember whats on it.

Bonus) Finding/Editing Positions for elements
    I have included a tool to get positions for buttons in {x,y,z} form
    Place it where you want the center of your element to be
    Then copy the table from the notes (lower right of screen)
        You can highlight it and CTRL+C
    Paste it into the data table where needed (pos=)
    If you want to manually tweek the values:
        {0,0,0} is the center of the character sheet
        {1,0,0} is right, {-1,0,0} is left
        {0,0,-1} is up, {0,0,1} is down
        0.1 for Y is the height off of the page.
            If it was 0, it would be down inside the model of the sheet

Begin editing below:    ]]
